questions.a: A HEX code is a six-digit hexadecimal number used in web design to represent colors. It starts with a hash symbol (#) followed by three pairs of characters representing red, green, and blue values.

questions.q: What is the difference between RGB and CMYK?
questions.a: RGB (Red, Green, Blue) is an additive color model used for digital screens. CMYK (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Key/Black) is a subtractive color model used for printing.
